status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0jr7","text":"Aspirate media off","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dsk4k","text":"Rinse with DPBS-/-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8e7a3","text":"Add 1X TrypLE, 1ml per 6 well, 2ml per T-25, 3ml per T-75 (can use as low as 0.75X TrypLE according to GESC, dilute in 0.5mM EDTA pH 8)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amll9","text":"Put in incubator until you see cells detaching (2 minutes to 5 minutes MAX), might have to move flask around to aid in that process","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ihm3","text":"When cells detach, take out of the incubator and add 2x the original volume minimum of fresh media in the vessel (to stop enzymatic reactions)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9kbbc","text":"Take cells and put them in a 15ml conical tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5uk44","text":"Spin down at 1200rpm for 5 min (200g/RCF)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c3vbo","text":"Take off supernatant, and resuspend cell pellet in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b83oo","text":"Media per well in 6-well is 2ml, 12-well is 1ml, T-25 is 5ml, T-75 is 20 mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54sg2","text":"IMPORTANT: Add ROCKi once you replate cells. 1ul ROCKi per 1ml of media in the vessel. Remove ROCKi via media change after 24 hrs. (ROCKi is not in the NComm paper, but is suggested by YiHsien and Vijay since it is commonly used to promote survival after single-cell dissociation and is used in the protocol. We have tested with and without and found significantly better differentiation to MNs with ROCKi). Note: RevitaCell is another ROCKi inhibitor (may be better than Y-27632).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"s3q4","text":"Perform single cell dissociation (see above for TryplE protocol - no ROCKi) up until and including the spin down at 200g for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"sbl1","text":"Resuspend in 1 mL Media, do the cell count","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"47m8u","text":"Spin down again. Aspirate the supernatant, resuspend in 1mL of Cryostor CS10 (or as many ml as vials you want to freeze down, ex: 2ml resuspension = 2 vials frozen down)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fa313","text":"Transfer the Cryostor/Cell solution with from the 15ml conical tube to the cryovial (1 ml per cryovial)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcm95","text":"Label tube (list that it is MNP, list if it has a library/guide/or no library, list what passage iiPS it came from, list the Step and Day it will be when we thaw, write date, write initials, write estimated cell count)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: MNP freezing protocol (to be used during any step of differentiation)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32sur","text":"Place vials on ice for 10 minutes before putting it in a styrofoam box in the -80C Freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2bseu","text":"After 24-48h transfer to permanent storage box in -80C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7pjud","text":"PDL Instructions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak41q","text":"Prepare a 1:2500 dilution of PDL in molecular grade water, making sure you have enough to coat whatever vessel you are working with (For a quad array: dissolve 2uL of PDL in 5mL of molecular grade water.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f319k","text":"Add 1mL per quad on the array.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eoq1q","text":"Incubate at 37 degrees for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nu25","text":"After 1 hour incubation, rinse thrice with molecular grade water as PDL can be toxic to cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8umeq","text":"Mouse Laminin Instructions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"buciv","text":"Thaw laminin at 2-8C to prevent it from gelling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58oqe","text":"Prepare a 1:300 dilution of laminin in molecular grade water, making sure you have enough to coat whatever vessel you are working with (For a quad array: Dissolve 14uL of laminin in 4.2mL of molecular grade water and add 1mL of the solution per quad)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9qd3t","text":"Incubate at 37 degrees for 4 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eftfh","text":"Aspirate laminin before use. Coated vessels can be used immediately without washing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"diihf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnlf3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"662np","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3k66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ddhp2","text":" In Yi-Hsien’s protocol, he mentions after PDL coating has been rinsed off 3 times, to leave the cultured vessel uncovered in the hood to dry for 2 hours- we do not do this currently, we just add the laminin coating right away. He also mentions that laminin only needs to be incubated for 2 hours at 37C or overnight at 2-8C, we currently incubate it for 4 hrs at 37C.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jppl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anjlf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6p4om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hql9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mk1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17aq2","text":"Protocol Overview","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epp1k","text":"To differentiate the iPSC cells, you have to grow them in 5 or 6 different media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3njkr","text":"From this point forward, only use the TrypLE protocol above when passaging. As stated in that protocol, add ROCKi EVERY TIME you use TrypLE (1ul/ml media). Remove ROCKi after 24hr via media change unless you are in the later stages of differentiation (Step 4 or Step 5- media changes are less frequent).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tgvv","text":" To start the differentiation process, transfer an appropriate amount of cells into your desired vessel using the TrypLE protocol listed above to single-cell dissociate iiPS cells. Use STEP1 media to resuspend and store the cells in a new matrigel coated el1ymvNEJ0ZQ/edit#slide=id.g127d8e5970e_0_0","width":"624"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":31,"offset":0,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"a72a7","text":"How to Count Days on Step Media","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4jskc","text":"When you place cells into a new Step Media, label this as Day 0. The next day is Day 1 and so on. Late in Day 5 or early in Day 6, switch to next media and again label cells as Day 0 of the next step. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fck4o","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":102,"offset":119,"style":"bold"}],"key":"e9947","text":"When freezing a tube, freeze it at the end of the day it is on and write the next day on the label of the frozen tube. So, when thawing a tube, write the day written on the vial on the flask/plate you are putting it into.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"3m735","text":"Additional Notes:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":84,"offset":77}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":84,"offset":77,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"1ihgg","text":"See iPSC protocol to start initial iPSC culture and get matrigel information https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHsnDDBfpc1NrD6D8PG0zEAY68w7QMn0iZm8rL64Vvc/edit","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"atgnc","text":"Keep each step media fresh- use within 4 days of making it.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7gtd7","text":"For non-library differentiation","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d3r4o","text":"Use 1 full well of a 6well plate (from previous protocol) into 3 T-25 as a starting point (around a few million cells total)","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e0icq","text":"Try to keep confluency around 80%","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9mu5t","text":"For library differentiation ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"feve5","text":"Make sure that at all times, you have at least 1000X coverage (number of cells= 1000 * # gRNAs in the library). Write on flask: “at all times maintain a minimum XXXX cell number”. Maintain this number when passaging. If the cell number is too large, it can be split into multiple vessels, but keep this in mind when freezing down, so you can combine cells which are in multiple vessels to maintain good library representation.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6t1ui","text":"At each step, even during the step, passage using the TryplE protocol as soon as cells get to 90%-95% confluency. Being crowded is fine, but do not let cells get overcrowded.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"art2s","text":"We use 0.1% P/S instead the original 1% in Yi-Hsien’s protocol, because we found that to have better cell survival and we can pick up on contamination faster (Waleed also uses this concentration) ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":86,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fkqc0","text":"If making a library, please freeze at every step just in case future steps go poorly. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":65,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"e7pql","text":"Components added to the base media at each step have been bolded.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"91ce7","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"7FE59D2E110911EE95190A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHsnDDBfpc1NrD6D8PG0zEAY68w7QMn0iZm8rL64Vvc/edit"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}
